Express the dopamine receptor [DOP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001052;class=Gene) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472), [Sanyal et al., 2004](http://www.nature.com/emboj/journal/v23/n2/abs/7600057a.html)).

ALNL.Description: Neurons associated with [ALM](ALMframeset.html), send processes into [tailspike](../../hermaphrodite/atypical/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Tailspikescaffoldcells2).
ALNL.Receptor Expression: Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00004777;class=Gene) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)). Express the dopamine receptor [DOP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001052;class=Gene) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)).  &nbsp_place_holder;  &nbsp_place_holder;

ALNR.Description: Neurons associated with [ALM](ALMframeset.html), send processes into [tailspike](../../hermaphrodite/atypical/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Tailspikescaffoldcells2).
ALNR.Receptor Expression: Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00004777;class=Gene) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)). Express the dopamine receptor [DOP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001052;class=Gene) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)).  &nbsp_place_holder;  &nbsp_place_holder;

AQR.Description: Postembryonically born neuron with rudimentary cilium. AQR and its ciliated dendrite are directly exposed to the pseudocoelomic body fluid. AQR axonal process projects into ring.
AQR.Function: ** Along with [PQR](PQRframeset.html), [URX](URXframeset.html) and [AUA](AUAframeset.html), AQR regulate social feeding (or aggregation on a bacterial lawn) and [bordering](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_behavior/ behavior.html#sec7_3) (the accumulation of animals on the thickest part of a bacterial lawn) behavior since suppressing the activity of AQR, [PQR](PQRframeset.html) and [URX](URXframeset.html) neurons inhibits social feeding ([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?nam e=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)). AQR, [PQR](PQRframeset.html) and [URX](URXframeset.html)function as sensors of environmental oxygen which is a quantitative regulator of social feeding ([Gray et al., 2004](http://www.wormb ase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00024211;class=Paper)). Decreases in oxygen leads to a dose-dependent suppression of social feeding behavior and bordering. Oxygen acts in parallel to [NPR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene) in regulating social feeding behavior.
AQR.Location: Head; right hand side near the posterior bulb of the pharynx.
AQR.Receptor Expression: Expresses orphan receptor (chemosensory/odorant?) guanylyl cyclase, [GCY-32](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001552;class=Gene) ([Yu et al., 1997](http://www.pnas.org/content/94/7/3384.long)). Expresses neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene) which mediates social feeding behavior ([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)). Expresses specific soluble guanylate cyclase homologue, [GCY-35 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001555;class=Gene)which binds molecular oxygen and mediates oxygen sensation ([Gray et al., 2004](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00024211;class=Paper)).

AS1.Description: Ventral cord motor neurons, born postembryonically. Innervate dorsal muscles, no ventral counterpart, similar to VAn but receive additional synaptic input from [AVB](AVBframeset.html). Note that unlike AS1-10, the commissure of AS11 originates from the posterior process. All AS commissures to DC run from the right side of the body. Hermaphrodites and males exhibit some differences in ASn connectivity.
AS1.Lineage: P1 apa, P2 apa, P3 apa P4 apa, P5 apa, P6 apa, P7 apa  P8 apa, P9 apa, P10 apa, P11 apa

AS6.Description: Ventral cord motor neurons, born postembryonically. Innervate dorsal muscles, no ventral counterpart, similar to VAn but receive additional synaptic input from [AVB](AVBframeset.html). Note that unlike AS1-10, the commissure of AS11 originates from the posterior process. All AS commissures to DC run from the right side of the body. Hermaphrodites and males exhibit some differences in ASn connectivity.
AS6.Lineage: P1 apa, P2 apa, P3 apa P4 apa, P5 apa, P6 apa, P7 apa  P8 apa, P9 apa, P10 apa, P11 apa

ASEL.Description: [ Amphid neurons](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil.
ASEL.Function: _ **   - Involved in[ chemotaxis](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_2) to cAMP, biotin, Cl-, Na+ and lysine; ASEL is primarily sensitive to Na+ , whereas ASER is primarily sensitive to Cl- and K+ ([Pierce-Shimomura et al., 2001](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00004609;class=Paper); [Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001481;class=Paper); [](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00004609;class=Paper)). Opposite intacellular Ca++ transients are suggested to be generated in ASEL and ASER in response to changes in NaCl concentrations [(Suzuki et al., 2004)](http://www.reference-global.com/doi/abs/10.1515/BC.2004.069). - ASH, ADL, ASK and ASE sensory neurons are responsible for the detection of certain chemical repellents. ASH plays a major role in this avoidance, whereas ADL, ASK and ASE play minor roles that are only evident when ASH is missing ([Hiliard et al., 2002](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982202008138); [Sambongi et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003464;class=Paper); [Bargmann et al, 1990](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2132836?dopt=Abstract&holding=npg).) Mediate avoidance behavior from Cd2+ and Cu2+ ([Sambongi et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003464;class=Paper)) - Functions in adaptive food-leaving behavior (leaving a food patch as it is becoming depleted to start foraging); the ASE neurons promote food-leaving behavior via a cGMP pathway as food becomes limited; in well-fed animals ASE neurons mediate chemoattraction to water-soluble cues as noted above. However, food withdrawal or gradual depletion of food turns this attraction to salt into repulsion. This switch in preference involves signaling by the DAF-2 insulin receptor in ASER as well as INS-1-dependent feedback from AIA to ASER ([Milward et al., 2011](http://www.pnas.org/content/108/51/20672.long); [Tomioka et al., 2006](http://www.cell.com/neuron/retrieve/pii/S0896627306005897"))
ASEL.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene), [ NLP-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003745;class=Gene), [NLP-14 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003752;class=Gene)([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)). Express the FMRFamide-related neuropeptide (FaRP), [FLP-21](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001464;class=Gene) ([Rogers et al., 2003](http://jcb.rupress.org/cgi/content/full/157/2/219)).
ASEL.Receptor Expression: ASEL expresses orphan receptor (chemosensory/odorant?) guanylyl cyclases [GCY-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001533;class=Gene) and [GCY-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001534;class=Gene) and ASER expresses [GCY-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001532;class=Gene) ([Yu et al., 1997](http://www.pnas.org/content/94/7/3384.long)). Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene)([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)).

Opposite intacellular Ca++ transients are suggested to be generated in ASEL and ASER in response to changes in NaCl concentrations [(Suzuki et al., 2004)](http://www.reference-global.com/doi/abs/10.1515/BC.2004.069). - ASH, ADL, ASK and ASE sensory neurons are responsible for the detection of certain chemical repellents. ASH plays a major role in this avoidance, whereas ADL, ASK and ASE play minor roles that are only evident when ASH is missing ([Hiliard et al., 2002](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982202008138); [Sambongi et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003464;class=Paper); [Bargmann et al, 1990](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2132836?dopt=Abstract&holding=npg).) However, food withdrawal or gradual depletion of food turns this attraction to salt into repulsion. This switch in preference involves signaling by the DAF-2 insulin receptor in ASER as well as INS-1-dependent feedback from AIA to ASER ([Milward et al., 2011](http://www.pnas.org/content/108/51/20672.long); [Tomioka et al., 2006](http://www.cell.com/neuron/retrieve/pii/S0896627306005897"))

Express the FMRFamide-related neuropeptide (FaRP), [FLP-21](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001464;class=Gene) ([Rogers et al., 2003](http://jcb.rupress.org/cgi/content/full/157/2/219)).
ASER.Receptor Expression: ASEL expresses orphan receptor (chemosensory/odorant?) guanylyl cyclases [GCY-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001533;class=Gene) and [GCY-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001534;class=Gene) and ASER expresses [GCY-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001532;class=Gene) ([Yu et al., 1997](http://www.pnas.org/content/94/7/3384.long)). Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene)([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)).

ASGL.Description: [ Amphid neurons](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil.
ASGL.Function: ** Involved in chemotaxis to lysine, contribute to a residual chemotactic response to cAMP, biotin, Cl-, and Na+ after [ASE](ASEframeset.html) is killed ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wor mbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001481;class=Paper)). Controls entry into dauer stage ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc /paper?name=WBPaper00001393;class=Paper)).
ASGL.Receptor Expression: Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene)([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)).  &nbsp_place_holder;  &nbsp_place_holder;

ASGR.Description: [ Amphid neurons](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil.
ASGR.Function: ** Involved in chemotaxis to lysine, contribute to a residual chemotactic response to cAMP, biotin, Cl-, and Na+ after [ASE](ASEframeset.html) is killed ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wor mbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001481;class=Paper)). Controls entry into dauer stage ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc /paper?name=WBPaper00001393;class=Paper)).
ASGR.Receptor Expression: Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene)([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)).  &nbsp_place_holder;  &nbsp_place_holder;

ASHL.Description: [Amphid neurons](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil. Also take up FITC.
ASHL.Function: _**    - ASH plays a major role in avoidance responses to [nose touch](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_behavior/behavior.html#sec2_7), [hyperosmolarity](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_behavior/behavior.html#sec3) (note: a mutation in the _glr-1 _(glutamate receptor subunit) gene which acts in synaptic targets of the ASH neurons, eliminates the response to nose touch but not to osmotic repellents), [volatile repellent chemicals](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_4) (1-octanol), heavy metals (Cd++ and Cu++), detergents/SDS, protons, alkaloids such as quinine (ASH is the main sensory neuron responsible for quinine detection and ASK plays a minor role) ([de Bono & Villu Maricq, 2005](http://www.annualreviews.org/doi/full/10.1146/annurev.neuro.27.070203.144259?url_ver=Z39.88-2003&rfr_id=ori:rid:crossref.org&rfr_dat=cr_pub%3dpubmed&); [Bargmann, 2006](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html); [](http://www.nature.com/emboj/journal/v23/n5/full/7600107a.html)[Hilliard et al, 2004](http://www.nature.com/emboj/journal/v23/n5/full/7600107a.html); [Hiliard et al., 2002](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982202008138);[ Hart et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=%5Bcgc3408%5D;class=Paper); [Sambongi et al., 2000](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10923676?dopt=Abstract); [Sambongi et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003464;class=Paper); [Troemel et al., 1995](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002314;class=Paper); [Bargmann et al, 1990](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2132836?dopt=Abstract&holding=npg);[ Culotti & Russell 1978.](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/730048?dopt=Abstract)) - ASH and ADL are proposed to mediate social feeding behavior in response to repulsive cues (ablation of ASH and ADL abolishes social feeding behavior transforming social animals to solitary feeders) ([de Bono M. et al., 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005511;class=Paper).)
ASHL.Neurotransmitter: [Glutamate](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html). ([Lee et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/159#F3)). Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=nlp-3;class=Locus) and [NLP-15](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003753;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)). Express the FMRFamide-related neuropeptide (FaRP), [FLP-21](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001464;class=Gene) ([Rogers et al., 2003](http://jcb.rupress.org/cgi/content/full/157/2/219)).
ASHL.Receptor Expression: **    - [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene); TRPV (transient receptor potential channel, vanilloid subfamily; mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel)-cation selective channel. Express TRPV channel proteins [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)) and [OCR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003839;class=Gene) ([Tobin et al., 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005350;class=Paper); [de Bono M. et al., 2002](http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/nature01169)). Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptors, [SRA-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005032;class=Gene), [SRB-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005071;class=Gene) ([Troemel et al., 1995](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002314;class=Paper)). Express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene) which mediates social feeding behavior ([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)). Express [UNC-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006748;class=Gene), a DEG/ENaC family member homologous to subunits of a candidate mechanically gated ion channel ([Tavernarakis et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002646;class=Paper)).  See DiI staining of ASH in [dorso-ventral view](../../images/DiI3.jpg); DiI staining of ASH in [lateral view](../../images/DiI2.jpg).
ASHL.Type: Sensory neuron (Osmo-, mechano- and odorsensory, nociceptive)

[Hiliard et al., 2002](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982202008138);[ Hart et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=%5Bcgc3408%5D;class=Paper); [Sambongi et al., 2000](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10923676?dopt=Abstract); ASIL.Description: [Amphid neurons](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil. Also take up FITC.
ASIL.Function: Gustatory sensory neurons. The main synpatic output of ASI is on to AIA interneuron. - Involved in**[ chemotaxis](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_2)** to lysine, contribute to a residual chemotactic response to cAMP, biotin, Cl-, and Na+ after ASE is killed ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001481;class=Paper)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc1481%5D/?%5Cb%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5D%5Bs%DF%5D%5Be%E9%E8%EA%EB%5D%5Cb)). - Controls ** entry into dauer stage **([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001393;class=Paper)). - Functions in **locomotion:** Suppresses omega turns and reversals enhancing dispersal ([Gray et al., 2005](http://www.pnas.org/content/102/9/3184.long)). After animals are removed from bacterial food, they initiate a **local search behavior** consisting of reversals and deep omega-shaped turns. This is followed by dispersal ~30 min later as reversal and turns are suppressed. Local search behavior is triggered by [AWC ](AWCframeset.html)olfactory neurons, [ASK](ASKframeset.html) gustatory neurons, and [AIB](AIBframeset.html) interneurons while dispersal is promoted by ASI gustatory neurons and [AIY](AIYframeset.html) interneurons ([Gray et al., 2005](http://www.pnas.org/content/102/9/3184.long)). - **Thermosensor: **After cultivation at a uniform temperature (Tc) with sufficient food, animals preferentially migrate to their cultivation temperature (Tc) when placed on a thermal gradient, and move isothermally at this temperature ([Hedgecock and Russell 1975](http://www.pnas.org/content/72/10/4061.abstract?ijkey=acd1f08536e1e2ccecf26dc714d2cc0ed9707751&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). Animals sense and record their Tc by [AFD](AFDframeset.html) (major thermosensory), AWC and ASI neurons ([Beverly et al, 2011](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/31/32/11718.full); [Kuhara et al., 2008](http://www.sciencemag.org/content/320/5877/803); [Biron et al., 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/31/11002.full)). This Tc memory is plastic and can be reset upon cultivation at a different temperature ([Hedgecock and Russell 1975](http://www.pnas.org/content/72/10/4061.abstract?ijkey=acd1f08536e1e2ccecf26dc714d2cc0ed9707751&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). Unlike AFD neurons, which respond to thermal stimuli above Tc with continuous, graded calcium signals in a deterministic and highly reproducible way, ASI neurons exhibit temperature-induced stochastic Ca++ transients in a defined operating range with decreased responses close to or far from Tc ([Beverly et al, 2011](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/31/32/11718.full)). - **Repression of pheromone (sexual) attraction** in hermaphrodites. _daf-7_ mutation or ablation of the ASI neuron pair, which is the sole source of DAF-7/TGF-β in_C. elegans,_ reveals sexual attraction (male-specific behavior) in hermaphrodites ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).
ASIL.Receptor Expression: Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptors, [SRD-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005079;class=Gene), [STR-2, STR-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006071;class=Gene) ([Peckol et al.. 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/20/11032.long)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?tool=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)).  See DiI staining of ASI in [dorso-ventral view](../../images/DiI3.jpg); DiI staining of ASI in [lateral view](../../images/DiI2.jpg).

ASIR.Description: [Amphid neurons](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil. Also take up FITC.

After animals are removed from bacterial food, they initiate a **local search behavior** consisting of reversals and deep omega-shaped turns. This is followed by dispersal ~30 min later as reversal and turns are suppressed. Local search behavior is triggered by [AWC ](AWCframeset.html)olfactory neurons, [ASK](ASKframeset.html) gustatory neurons, and [AIB](AIBframeset.html) interneurons while dispersal is promoted by ASI gustatory neurons and [AIY](AIYframeset.html) interneurons ([Gray et al., 2005](http://www.pnas.org/content/102/9/3184.long)). - **Thermosensor: **After cultivation at a uniform temperature (Tc) with sufficient food, animals preferentially migrate to their cultivation temperature (Tc) when placed on a thermal gradient, and move isothermally at this temperature ([Hedgecock and Russell 1975](http://www.pnas.org/content/72/10/4061.abstract?ijkey=acd1f08536e1e2ccecf26dc714d2cc0ed9707751&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). Animals sense and record their Tc by [AFD](AFDframeset.html) (major thermosensory), AWC and ASI neurons ([Beverly et al, 2011](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/31/32/11718.full); [Kuhara et al., 2008](http://www.sciencemag.org/content/320/5877/803); [Biron et al., 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/31/11002.full)). This Tc memory is plastic and can be reset upon cultivation at a different temperature ([Hedgecock and Russell 1975](http://www.pnas.org/content/72/10/4061.abstract?ijkey=acd1f08536e1e2ccecf26dc714d2cc0ed9707751&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). Unlike AFD neurons, which respond to thermal stimuli above Tc with continuous, graded calcium signals in a deterministic and highly reproducible way, ASI neurons exhibit temperature-induced stochastic Ca++ transients in a defined operating range with decreased responses close to or far from Tc ([Beverly et al, 2011](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/31/32/11718.full)). - **Repression of pheromone (sexual) attraction** in hermaphrodites. _daf-7_ mutation or ablation of the ASI neuron pair, which is the sole source of DAF-7/TGF-β in_C. elegans,_ reveals sexual attraction (male-specific behavior) in hermaphrodites ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).

Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?tool=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)).  See DiI staining of ASI in [dorso-ventral view](../../images/DiI3.jpg); DiI staining of ASI in [lateral view](../../images/DiI2.jpg).

ASJL.Description: [Amphid neurons](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil. Also take up FITC.
ASJL.Function: Controls exit from dauer stage ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001393;class=Paper)).
ASJL.Receptor Expression: Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptors, [SRE-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005149;class=Gene) ([Troemel et al., 1995](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002314;class=Paper)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?tool=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)). Also take up FITC.
ASJR.Function: Controls exit from dauer stage ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001393;class=Paper)).

ASKL.Description: [Amphid neurons](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31), [single ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1), project into ring via commissure from ventral ganglion, make diverse synaptic connections in ring neuropil. Also take up FITC.
ASKL.Function: _ **   - Involved in[ chemotaxis](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_2) to lysine ([Bargmann and Horvitz, 1991](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001481;class=Paper)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc1481%5D/?%5Cb%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5D%5Bs%DF%5D%5Be%E9%E8%EA%EB%5D%5Cb)). - ASH, ADL, ASK and ASE sensory neurons are responsible for the detection of certain chemical repellents. ASH plays a major role in this avoidance, whereas ADL, ASK and ASE play minor roles that are only evident when ASH is missing ([Hiliard et al., 2002](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982202008138); [Sambongi et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003464;class=Paper); [Bargmann et al, 1990](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2132836?dopt=Abstract&holding=npg).) Mediate avoidance behavior from protons, detergents, alkaloids such as quinine -ASH is the main sensory neuron responsible for quinine detection while ASK plays a minor role ([Hilliard et al, 2004](http://www.nature.com/emboj/journal/v23/n5/full/7600107a.html)). - After animals are removed from bacterial food, they initiate a **local search behavior** consisting of reversals and deep omega-shaped turns. This is followed by dispersal ~30 min later, as reversals and turns are suppressed. Local search behavior is triggered by AWC olfactory neurons, ASK gustatory neurons, and AIB interneurons while dispersal is promoted by ASI gustatory neurons and AIY interneurons ([Gray et al., 2005](http://www.pnas.org/content/102/9/3184.long)). - One of the three core sensory neurons (AWA, AWC, ASK) that are required for sexual-attraction in males ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).
ASKL.Neurotransmitter: [Glutamate](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html). Expresses VGluT,[ EAT-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001135;class=Gene) ([Lee et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/159#F3)). Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003746;class=Gene), [NLP-10](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003748;class=Gene), [NLP-14 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003752;class=Gene)([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
ASKL.Receptor Expression: **   - [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene); TRPV (transient receptor potential channel, vanilloid subfamily; mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel)-cation selective channel ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)).  - Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptors, [SRA-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005033;class=Gene), [SRA-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005035;class=Gene), [SRG-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005160;class=Gene), [SRG-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005166;class=Gene) ([Troemel et al., 1995](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002314;class=Paper)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?too l=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)).  See DiI staining of ASK in [dorso-ventral view](../../images/DiI3.jpg); DiI staining of ASK in [lateral view](../../images/DiI2.jpg).

Also take up FITC.

ASH plays a major role in this avoidance, whereas ADL, ASK and ASE play minor roles that are only evident when ASH is missing ([Hiliard et al., 2002](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0960982202008138); [Sambongi et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003464;class=Paper); [Bargmann et al, 1990](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2132836?dopt=Abstract&holding=npg).) Mediate avoidance behavior from protons, detergents, alkaloids such as quinine -ASH is the main sensory neuron responsible for quinine detection while ASK plays a minor role ([Hilliard et al, 2004](http://www.nature.com/emboj/journal/v23/n5/full/7600107a.html)). - After animals are removed from bacterial food, they initiate a **local search behavior** consisting of reversals and deep omega-shaped turns. This is followed by dispersal ~30 min later, as reversals and turns are suppressed. Local search behavior is triggered by AWC olfactory neurons, ASK gustatory neurons, and AIB interneurons while dispersal is promoted by ASI gustatory neurons and AIY interneurons ([Gray et al., 2005](http://www.pnas.org/content/102/9/3184.long)). - One of the three core sensory neurons (AWA, AWC, ASK) that are required for sexual-attraction in males ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).
ASKR.Neurotransmitter: [Glutamate](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html). Expresses VGluT,[ EAT-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001135;class=Gene) ([Lee et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/159#F3)). Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003746;class=Gene), [NLP-10](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003748;class=Gene), [NLP-14 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003752;class=Gene)([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
ASKR.Receptor Expression: **   - [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene); TRPV (transient receptor potential channel, vanilloid subfamily; mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel)-cation selective channel ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)).  - Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptors, [SRA-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005033;class=Gene), [SRA-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005035;class=Gene), [SRG-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005160;class=Gene), [SRG-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00005166;class=Gene) ([Troemel et al., 1995](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002314;class=Paper)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?too l=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)).  See DiI staining of ASK in [dorso-ventral view](../../images/DiI3.jpg); DiI staining of ASK in [lateral view](../../images/DiI2.jpg).

AUAL.Description: Neurons, processes run with [amphid neuron](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31) dendrites but lack [ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1).
AUAL.Function: Regulate social feeding behavior along with [AQR](AQRframeset.html), [PQR](file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Laura/Desktop/WORMATLAS%20Site%20development/Wormatlas072009/neurons/Individual%20Neurons/PQRframeset.html) and [URX](file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Laura/Desktop/WORMATLAS%20Site%20development/Wormatlas072009/neurons/Individual%20Neurons/URXframeset.html) neurons ([Coates and de Bono, 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)).
AUAL.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunit, [GLR-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001615;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene) which mediates social feeding behavior ([Coates and de Bono , 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)). Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [ SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)). Possibly express the dopamine receptor [DOP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001052;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=dop-1;class=Locus) ([Sanyal et al., 2004](http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/sj.emboj.7600057)).  &nbsp_place_holder;

AVAL.Function: ** Command interneuron. Functions as driver cell for backward locomotion. Drives backward movement of the animal along with touch modulator [AVD](AVDframeset.html) neuron, [AVE](AVEframeset.html) and A-type motor neurons. See [Locomotory circuit](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov:80/books/bv.fcgi ?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.figgrp.783).
AVAL.Location: ** Lateral ganglia of head**   Description:** One of four bilaterally symmetric interneuron pairs (AVA, [AVB](AVBframeset.html), [AVD](AVDframeset.html), and [PVC](PVCframeset.html)) with large-diameter axons that run the entire length of the ventral nerve cord and provide input to the ventral cord motor neurons. Synapse onto A-type ([VA](VAframeset.html), [DA](DAframeset.html)) and [AS](ASframeset.html) motor neurons. Formerly called alpha.
AVAL.Neurotransmitter: **FMRFamide (FLP-1). Express FMRFamide-like peptide, [FLP-1](http //www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001444;class=Gene) precursor ([Nelson et al., 1998](http //www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003158;class=Paper)). Express the FMRFamide-related neuropeptide (FaRP), [FLP-18](http //www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001461;class=Gene) ([Rogers et al., 2003](http **FMRFamide (FLP-1). AVFL.Description: Interneurons, processes in ventral cord and ring, few synapses. In some animals posterior process of AVFR may extend into (R) dorsorectal commissure instead of ending in preanal ganglion ([Hall and Russell, 1991](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/11/1/1.abstract)).

AVFR.Description: Interneurons, processes in ventral cord and ring, few synapses. In some animals posterior process of AVFR may extend into (R) dorsorectal commissure instead of ending in preanal ganglion ([Hall and Russell, 1991](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/11/1/1.abstract)).

AVG.Description: Ventral cord interneuron, few synapses, sends process into [tailspike](file:///C:/Documents and Settings/Laura/Desktop/WORMATLAS Site development/Wormatlas072009/hermaphrodite/atypical/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Tailspikescaffoldcells2).
AVG.Function: Anterior guidepost neuron. AVG pioneers the right tract of the ventral nerve cord. It expresses [UNC-6 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006746;class=Gene)at 3-fold embryo stage to provide a continuous [UNC-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006746;class=Gene) (netrin)-labeled pathway restricted to the right tract of the nerve cord. The unilateral [UNC-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006746;class=Gene) cue from AVG guides various paired axons growing from the nerve ring and lumbar ganglia to make rightward decussations as they enter the ventral nerve cord. [UNC-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006746;class=Gene) also promotes bundling of axons within the cord itself. If the parent of AVG is ablated in wild-type embryos, interneurons and ventral cord motor neurons form several small fascicles rather than one tight bundle of right side tract and occasionally the right side axons shift to the left side ([Wadsworth et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002378;class=Paper); [Wadsworth and Hedgecock, 1986](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sites/entrez?db=pubmed&cmd=retrieve&dopt=AbstractPlus&list_uids=8639159); [Durbin 1987](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/durbinv1.2/chapter3.html); [Antebi et al., 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov:80/books/bv.fcgi?tool=bookshelf&call=bv.View..ShowSection&searchterm=pvt&rid=ce2.section.727)).
AVG.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunits, [GLR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001612;class=Gene), [GLR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001613;class=Gene), [NMR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003774;class=Gene) and [NMR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003774;class=Gene) ([Maricq et al., 1995](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002308;class=Paper); [Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Expresses alpha subunit of a nicotinic [acetylcholine receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html#sec6), [DEG-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=deg-3;class=Locus) ([Treinin and Chalfie, 1995](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WSS-4CWYS0K-R&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=6d77922c0d406fdedd8bb40382906482)).

AVHL.Description: Neurons, mainly presynaptic in ring and postsynaptic in ventral cord.
AVHL.Receptor Expression: [GLR-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001615;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)). Suggested to express GABA-A/glycine receptor-like protein [GGR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001586;class=Gene) ([Fujiwara et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00015370;class=Paper)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=%5Bwbg14.4p69%5D;class=Paper)).

AVHR.Description: Neurons, mainly presynaptic in ring and postsynaptic in ventral cord.
AVHR.Receptor Expression: [GLR-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001615;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)). Suggested to express GABA-A/glycine receptor-like protein [GGR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001586;class=Gene) ([Fujiwara et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00015370;class=Paper)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=%5Bwbg14.4p69%5D;class=Paper)).

AVJL.Description: Ring and ventral cord interneuron Mainly postsynaptic in ventral cord and presynaptic in ring.
AVJL.Neurotransmitter: Possibly [glutamate](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html) (the neuron may be [AIN](AINframeset.html) instead). possibly expresses VGluT, [EAT-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001135;class=Gene) ([Lee et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/159#F3)).

AVJR.Description: Ring and ventral cord interneuron Mainly postsynaptic in ventral cord and presynaptic in ring.
AVJR.Neurotransmitter: Possibly [glutamate](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html) (the neuron may be [AIN](AINframeset.html) instead). possibly expresses VGluT, [EAT-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001135;class=Gene) ([Lee et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/159#F3)).

AVKL.Description: Ring and ventral cord interneuron. Mainly postsynaptic in ventral cord and presynaptic in ring. After making a full loop around the nerve ring, AVKR axon runs posteriorly on the left side of the ventralcord, AVKL axon, on the other hand, runs on the right side of the ventral cord.
AVKL.Neurotransmitter: Express FMRFamide-like peptide, [FLP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001444;class=Gene) precursor ([Nelson et al., 1998](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003158;class=Paper)).
AVKL.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunit [GLR-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001616;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

AVKR.Description: Ring and ventral cord interneuron. Mainly postsynaptic in ventral cord and presynaptic in ring. After making a full loop around the nerve ring, AVKR axon runs posteriorly on the left side of the ventralcord, AVKL axon, on the other hand, runs on the right side of the ventral cord.
AVKR.Neurotransmitter: Express FMRFamide-like peptide, [FLP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001444;class=Gene) precursor ([Nelson et al., 1998](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003158;class=Paper)).
AVKR.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunit [GLR-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001616;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

AVL.Description: An excitatory motor neuron for enteric muscles as well as a ring and ventral cord interneuron, few synapses.
AVL.Function: [Defecation](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_intestine/intestine.html#sec5_3). AVL and [DVB](DVBframeset.html) are excitatory GABAergic motor neurons for the enteric muscles ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.840); [McIntire et al., 1993](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001760;class=Paper)). Together with [DVB](DVBframeset.html), activates expulsion muscle contraction (E.p or EMC), also required for anterior body contraction (aBoc) step in [defecation motor program](../../hermaphrodite/rectum/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Defecationmotorprogram7) (DMP).

AVM.Description: Anterior ventral microtubule cell, touch receptor
AVM.Location: Lateral. Right side of the anterior half of the body.

AWAL.Description: [Amphid ](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31) wing "A" cells. Have [ciliated sheet-like sensory endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) closely associated with [amphid sheath](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Socketandsheathcells22).
AWAL.Function: ** [Chemotaxis](http //www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/c hemosensation.html#sec1) to diacetyl, pyrazine, trimethylthiazole ([Bargmann et al., 1993](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001786;class =Paper)). One of the three core sensory neurons (AWA, AWC, ASK) that are required for sexual-attraction in males ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).
AWAL.Receptor Expression: Express 7-TM diacetyl receptor [ODR-10](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003856;class=Gene) ([Sengupta et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002421;class=Paper); [Zhang et al., 1997](http://www.pnas.org/content/94/22/12162.long)). Express TRPV (mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel) proteins [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)) and [OCR-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003838;class=Gene)and [OCR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003839;class=Gene) ([Tobin et al., 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005350;class=Paper)).

AWAR.Description: [Amphid ](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31) wing "A" cells. Have [ciliated sheet-like sensory endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) closely associated with [amphid sheath](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Socketandsheathcells22).
AWAR.Function: ** [Chemotaxis](http //www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/c hemosensation.html#sec1) to diacetyl, pyrazine, trimethylthiazole ([Bargmann et al., 1993](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001786;class =Paper)). One of the three core sensory neurons (AWA, AWC, ASK) that are required for sexual-attraction in males ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).
AWAR.Receptor Expression: Express 7-TM diacetyl receptor [ODR-10](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003856;class=Gene) ([Sengupta et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002421;class=Paper); [Zhang et al., 1997](http://www.pnas.org/content/94/22/12162.long)). Express TRPV (mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel) proteins [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)) and [OCR-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003838;class=Gene)and [OCR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003839;class=Gene) ([Tobin et al., 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005350;class=Paper)).

AWBL.Description: [ Amphid](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31) wing "B" cells. Have [ciliated sheet-like sensory endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) closely associated with [amphid sheath](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Socketandsheathcells22).
AWBL.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=nlp-3;class=Locus) and [NLP-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003747;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
AWBL.Receptor Expression: Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptor [STR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006069;class=Gene) ([Troemel et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002917;class=Paper)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?tool=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)). Suggested to express [AEX-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000085;class=Gene), a 7-transmembrane domain protein with homology to the G protein-coupled receptor family ([Mahoney et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1073/pnas.0803617105)).

AWBR.Description: [ Amphid](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31) wing "B" cells. Have [ciliated sheet-like sensory endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) closely associated with [amphid sheath](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Socketandsheathcells22).
AWBR.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=nlp-3;class=Locus) and [NLP-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003747;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
AWBR.Receptor Expression: Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptor [STR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006069;class=Gene) ([Troemel et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002917;class=Paper)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?tool=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)). Suggested to express [AEX-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000085;class=Gene), a 7-transmembrane domain protein with homology to the G protein-coupled receptor family ([Mahoney et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1073/pnas.0803617105)).

AWCL.Description: [Amphid](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31) wing "C" cells. Have [ciliated sheet-like sensory endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) closely associated with [amphid sheath](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Socketandsheathcells22).
AWCL.Function: _ **   - AWC olfactory neurons are critical for **chemotaxis **to volatile odorants, (e.g. [chemotaxis](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_2) to benzaldehyde, butanone, isoamylalcohol, 2,3 pentanedione and 2,4,5 trimethylthiazole) - They function in induction of **local search behavior** and **promoting turns**. After animals are removed from bacterial food, they initiate a local search behavior consisting of reversals and deep omega-shaped turns. This is followed by dispersal ~30 min later as reversal and turns are suppressed. Local search behavior is triggered by AWC olfactory neurons, [ASK](ASKframeset.html) gustatory neurons, and [AIB](AIBframeset.html) interneurons while dispersal is promoted by [ASI](ASIframeset.html) gustatory neurons and [AIY](AIYframeset.html) interneurons ([Gray et al., 2005](http://www.pnas.org/content/102/9/3184.long)).The AWC neurons synapse onto several interneurons including [AIB ](AIBframeset.html)and [AIY](AIYframeset.html), which enhance and suppress turning, respectively. The AWC neurons activate the [AIB](AIBframeset.html) interneurons through AMPA-type glutamate receptors and inhibit [AIY](AIYframeset.html) interneurons through glutamate-gated chloride channels. AWC are odor-OFF neurons that are activated by odor removal and inhibited in the continued presence of odors. On prolonged exposure to odorant (over 30&nbsp_place_holder;min), adaptation to AWC-sensed odors occurs, abrogating the chemotactic response. [NLP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/species/c_elegans/gene/WBGene00003739) is required for these AWC-dependent food-evoked behaviors and odor adaptation ([Chalasani et al., 2010](http://www.nature.com/neuro/journal/v13/n5/full/nn.2526.html); [Chalasani et al., 2007](http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v450/n7166/full/nature06292.html); [Gray et al., 2005](http://www.pnas.org/content/102/9/3184.full); [L'Etoile and Bargmann, 2000](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0896-6273(00)81061-2); [Bargmann et al., 1993](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/0092-8674(93)80053-H)). - **Thermosensor: **After cultivation at a uniform temperature (Tc) with sufficient food, animals preferentially migrate to their cultivation temperature (Tc) when placed on a thermal gradient, and move isothermally at this temperature ([Hedgecock and Russell 1975](http://www.pnas.org/content/72/10/4061.abstract?ijkey=acd1f08536e1e2ccecf26dc714d2cc0ed9707751&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). Animals sense and record their Tc by [AFD](AFDframeset.html) (major thermosensory) and AWC and ASI neurons ([Beverly et al, 2011](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/31/32/11718.full); [Kuhara et al., 2008](http://www.sciencemag.org/content/320/5877/803); [Biron et al., 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/31/11002.full)). This Tc memory is plastic and can be reset upon cultivation at a different temperature ([Hedgecock and Russell 1975](http://www.pnas.org/content/72/10/4061.abstract?ijkey=acd1f08536e1e2ccecf26dc714d2cc0ed9707751&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). Activity of both the AFD and the AWC neurons is essential for the execution of thermotactic behaviors with high fidelity and precision. Upon sensation of a higher temperature than Tc, Ca++ concetration in AWC increases via production of cGMP by [ODR-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/species/c_elegans/gene/WBGene00003848)and activation of cGMP-dependent [TAX-4 ](http://www.wormbase.org/species/c_elegans/gene/WBGene00006526)cation channel ([Kuhara et al., 2008](http://www.sciencemag.org/content/320/5877/803)). Unlike AFD neurons, which respond to thermal stimuli above Tc with continuous, graded calcium signals in a deterministic and highly reproducible way, AWC neurons exhibit stochastic temperature-evoked Ca++ changes that are stimulus-correlated with different temporal kinetics at temperatures above and below Tc ([Biron et al., 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/31/11002.full)). AWC appears to get more active as temperatures rise or fall &nbsp_place_holder;further from Tc. The AFD, AWC and ASI neurons seem to act in concert to increase turning rate when animals encounter higher temperatures than Tc on a gradient to move down the gradient toward colder temperatures near Tc (negative thermotaxis) ([Biron et al., 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/31/11002.full)). To track isotherms, animals do not actively pursue isothermal alignment, but once serendipitously aligned along an isotherm (at T=Tc), they track by suppressing turns ([Luo et al., 2006](http://jeb.biologists.org/content/209/23/4652.abstract?ijkey=633724e8b725756ac9b884de520177117034b20d&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). AWC neurons are relatively quiet around temperatures close to the Tc. - One of the three core sensory neurons (AWA, AWC, ASK) that are required for sexual-attraction in males ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).
AWCL.Neurotransmitter: **    - Glutamate (AWC-AIA synapse is an inhibitory, glutamatergic synapse whose function is acutely modulated by NLP-1/NPR-11 signaling) - [NLP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/species/c_elegans/gene/WBGene00003739); neuropeptide-like protein ([Chalasani et al., 2010](http://www.nature.com/neuro/journal/v13/n5/full/nn.2526.html);[ Glauser and Goodman, 2010](http://www.nature.com/neuro/journal/v13/n5/full/nn0510-528. html#/references); [Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long))
AWCL.Receptor Expression: Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?tool=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)). Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptor, [STR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006070;class=Gene), asymmetrically (randomly on the right or left side) ([Troemel et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003760;class=Paper)).

AWCR.Description: [Amphid](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Amphidsensilla31) wing "C" cells. Have [ciliated sheet-like sensory endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) closely associated with [amphid sheath](http://wormatlas.org/hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Socketandsheathcells22).

This Tc memory is plastic and can be reset upon cultivation at a different temperature ([Hedgecock and Russell 1975](http://www.pnas.org/content/72/10/4061.abstract?ijkey=acd1f08536e1e2ccecf26dc714d2cc0ed9707751&keytype2=tf_ipsecsha)). AWC neurons are relatively quiet around temperatures close to the Tc. - One of the three core sensory neurons (AWA, AWC, ASK) that are required for sexual-attraction in males ([White and Jorgensen, 2012](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0896627312005739)).
AWCR.Neurotransmitter: **    - Glutamate (AWC-AIA synapse is an inhibitory, glutamatergic synapse whose function is acutely modulated by NLP-1/NPR-11 signaling) - [NLP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/species/c_elegans/gene/WBGene00003739); neuropeptide-like protein ([Chalasani et al., 2010](http://www.nature.com/neuro/journal/v13/n5/full/nn.2526.html);[ Glauser and Goodman, 2010](http://www.nature.com/neuro/journal/v13/n5/full/nn0510-528. html#/references); [Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long))
AWCR.Receptor Expression: Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express transmembrane guanylyl cyclase [DAF-11](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000907;class=Gene) ([Birnby et al., 2000](http://www.pubmedcentral.nih.gov/articlerender.fcgi?tool=pubmed&pubmedid=10790386)). Express G protein-coupled serpentine receptor, [STR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006070;class=Gene), asymmetrically (randomly on the right or left side) ([Troemel et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003760;class=Paper)).

BAGL.Description: Have ciliated endings in head, not part of a sensillum. The endings are not open to outside.
BAGL.Function: A neural circuit that includes BAG neurons mediate acute CO2 avoidance ([Hallem and Sternberg, 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/23/8038.long); [Bretscher et al., 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/23/8044.long target=))
BAGL.Location: Anterior to the nerve ring in head
BAGL.Receptor Expression: Expresses orphan receptor (chemosensory/odorant?) guanylyl cyclase, [GCY-33](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001553;class=Gene) ([Yu et al., 1997](http://www.pnas.org/content/94/7/3384.long)).

BAGR.Description: Have ciliated endings in head, not part of a sensillum. The endings are not open to outside.
BAGR.Function: A neural circuit that includes BAG neurons mediate acute CO2 avoidance ([Hallem and Sternberg, 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/23/8038.long); [Bretscher et al., 2008](http://www.pnas.org/content/105/23/8044.long target=))
BAGR.Location: Anterior to the nerve ring in head
BAGR.Receptor Expression: Expresses orphan receptor (chemosensory/odorant?) guanylyl cyclase, [GCY-33](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001553;class=Gene) ([Yu et al., 1997](http://www.pnas.org/content/94/7/3384.long)).

BDUL.Description: Interneuron, process runs along excretory canal and then into NR via the deirid commissures.
BDUL.Function: Guidance for AVM process outgrowth during L1 stage ([Walthall and Chalfie, 1988](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001025;class=Paper)).
BDUL.Location: Lateral. Left and right sides of the anterior half of the body.
BDUL.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003739;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=nlp-1;class=Locus) and [NLP-15](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003753;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
BDUL.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunit, [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)).

BDUR.Description: Interneuron, process runs along excretory canal and then into NR via the deirid commissures.
BDUR.Function: Guidance for AVM process outgrowth during L1 stage ([Walthall and Chalfie, 1988](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001025;class=Paper)).
BDUR.Location: Lateral. Left and right sides of the anterior half of the body.
BDUR.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003739;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=nlp-1;class=Locus) and [NLP-15](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003753;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
BDUR.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunit, [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)).

CANL*.Description: Process runs along excretory canal, no chemical synapses seen, some gap junctions to excretory cells, essential for survival. Posterior processes terminate at the anus.
CANL*.Neurotransmitter: Monoamine. Express VMaT,[ CAT-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000295;class=Gene) ([Duerr et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/72)). Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-10](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003748;class=Gene) and [NLP-15](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003753;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
CANL*.Receptor Expression: Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)). Suggested to express GABA-A/glycine receptor-like protein [GGR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001587;class=Gene) ([Fujiwara et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00015370;class=Paper)).

CANR*.Description: Process runs along excretory canal, no chemical synapses seen, some gap junctions to excretory cells, essential for survival. Posterior processes terminate at the anus.
CANR*.Neurotransmitter: Monoamine. Express VMaT,[ CAT-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000295;class=Gene) ([Duerr et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/72)). Express neuropeptide-like proteins, [NLP-10](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003748;class=Gene) and [NLP-15](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003753;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
CANR*.Receptor Expression: Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)). Suggested to express GABA-A/glycine receptor-like protein [GGR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001587;class=Gene) ([Fujiwara et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00015370;class=Paper)).

CEPDL.Description: Neurons of [cephalic sensilla](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Cephalicsensilla32), the CEP sensory processes extend to the tip of the nose. Express [acetylcholinesterase](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html) of class A, [ACE-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000035;class=Gene) ([Culetto et al., 1999](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003620;class=Paper)). CEP neurons are directly exposed to the pseudocoelomic body fluid.
CEPDL.Function: [Mechanosensory](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_mechanosensation/mechanosensation.html) function in the head. When well-fed _C. elegans_ hermaphrodites are washed clean of bacteria and then reintroduced to the bacterial lawn, they move more slowly than when transferred to an environment without bacteria. This behavior is described as "basal slowing response". The three classes of dopaminergic neurons ([CEPs](file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Laura/Desktop/WORMATLAS%20Site%20development/Wormatlas072009/neurons/Individual%20Neurons/CEPframeset.html), [ADEs](ADEframeset.html), and [PDEs](file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Laura/Desktop/WORMATLAS%20Site%20development/Wormatlas072009/neurons/Individual%20Neurons/PDEframeset.html)) function redundantly to sense the mechanosensory stimulus from bacteria and mediate the motor circuit to control this behavioral change ([Sawin et al., 2000](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00004195;class=Paper)).
CEPDL.Lineage: AB plaaaaappa, AB arpapaappa AB plpaappppa, AB prpaappppa
CEPDL.Receptor Expression: Express the dopamine receptor [DOP-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001053;class=Gene) ([Suo et al., 2003](http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/cgi-bin/fulltext/118871307/HTMLSTART)).

DA1.Description: Ventral cord "dorsal A" motor neurons. These neurons innervate dorsal muscles. Hermaphrodites and males exhibit some differences in DAn connectivity.
DA1.Function: Backward locomotion. DA's receive input from the driver interneuron [AVA](AVAframeset.html), and modulator interneurons [AVD](AVDframeset.html) and [AVE](AVEframeset.html). They send output to [VD](VDframeset.html) neurons. See [Locomotory circuit](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov:80/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.figgrp.783).
DA1.Lineage: AB prppapaap, AB plppapapa AB prppapapa, AB plppapapp  AB prppapapp, AB plpppaaap  AB prpppaaap, AB prpapappp,  AB plpppaaaa
DA1.Receptor Expression: Expresses [UNC-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006748;class=Gene)[](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006748;class=Gene), a DEG/ENaC family member homologous to subunits of a candidate mechanically gated ion channel ([Tavernarakis et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002646;class=Paper)). DA9 expresses a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472); [Goodman, 2006](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_mechanosensation/mechanosensation.html)).

DD1.Description: ** [GABA](http //www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_gaba/gaba.html)ergic inhibitory ventral cord motor neurons. DD's receive dyadic synapses from excitatory ventral cord motor neurons along with body wall muscles. The initial pattern of synapses made by DD neurons are presynaptic and inhibitory to ventral body wall muscles while being postsynaptic to neurons that activate dorsal body wall muscles. During late L1, after the birth of [VD](VDframeset.html) motor neurons, DD neurons change their synaptic pattern such that their dorsal branches become presynaptic and inhibitory to dorsal body wall muscles while their ventral branches become postsynaptic to excitatory neurons that synapse on ventral body wall muscles ([White et al., 1978](http //www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00000401;class=Paper); [Walthall et al., 1993](http** [GABA](http //www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_gaba/gaba.html)ergic inhibitory ventral cord motor neurons. DD's receive dyadic synapses from excitatory ventral cord motor neurons along with body wall muscles. The initial pattern of synapses made by DD neurons are presynaptic and inhibitory to ventral body wall muscles while being postsynaptic to neurons that activate dorsal body wall muscles. During late L1, after the birth of [VD](VDframeset.html) motor neurons, DD neurons change their synaptic pattern such that their dorsal branches become presynaptic and inhibitory to dorsal body wall muscles while their ventral branches become postsynaptic to excitatory neurons that synapse on ventral body wall muscles ([White et al., 1978](http //www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00000401;class=Paper); [Walthall et al., 1993](http //www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001847;class=Paper)). Hermaphrodites and males exhibit some differences in DDn connectivity.**   Neurotransmitter:
DD1.Function: Sinusoidal body movement. DD's receive input from [VA](VAframeset.html) and[ VB](VBframeset.html) neurons, and hence, are likely to be active during ventral muscle contractions. They form neuromuscular junctions dorsally that coordinately relax the dorsal muscles during ventral muscle contraction ([Driscoll and Kaplan, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?rid=ce2.chapter.777)). D-type neurons may also regulate the wave amplitude of the sinusoidal movement since [unc-25](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006762;class=Gene) and [unc-30](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006766;class=Gene) mutants that lack functional D neurons generate rhythmic sinusoidal movement with a reduced amplitude ([McIntire et al., 1993](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8332190?ordinalpos=14&itool=EntrezSystem2.PEntrez.Pubmed.Pubmed_ResultsPanel.Pubmed_DefaultReportPanel.Pubmed_RVDocSum)).
DD1.Lineage: AB plppappap, AB prppappap AB plppapppa, AB prppapppa  AB plppapppp, AB prppapppp
