DD6.Lineage: AB plppappap, AB prppappap AB plppapppa, AB prppapppa  AB plppapppp, AB prppapppp

DVA.Function: Mechanosensory integration. The [PVD](PVDframeset.html) and DVA neurons are presynaptic to both the forward and backing interneurons, and provide input to both the anterior and posterior touch circuits. Animals lacking these neurons respond to tap stimulus with diminished forward accelerations and reversals. These neurons, therefore, seem to maintain the overall activity of the touch circuit ([Wicks et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002468;class=Paper); [Driscoll and Kaplan, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?rid=ce2.chapter.777)[](Driscoll and Kaplan, 1997); [Goodman, 2007](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_mechanosensation/mechanosensation.html#d0e893)). DVA represents a stretch receptor neuron that regulates sensory-motor integration during _C. elegans _locomotion. _[trp-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006616;class=Gene)_, a homologue of the mechanosensitive TRPN channel, acts as a stretch-sensitive proprioceptor in DVA. DVA both positively and negatively modulates locomotion, providing a unique mechanism whereby a single neuron can fine-tune motor activity ([Li et al., 2006](http://wormbase.sanger.ac.uk/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00027194;class=Paper)).
DVA.Receptor Expression: Expresses glutamate receptor subunits, [GLR-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001615;class=Gene),[ GLR-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001616;class=Gene) and [NMR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003774;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Expresses a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00004777;class=Gene) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14568548?ordinalpos=2&itool=EntrezSystem2.PEntrez.Pubmed.Pubmed_ResultsPanel.Pubmed_DefaultReportPanel.Pubmed_RVDocSum)). Variably expresses the serotonin receptor [SER-4](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00004779;class=Gene) (can be instead [DVC](DVCframeset.html) neuron) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14568548?ordinalpos=2&itool=EntrezSystem2.PEntrez.Pubmed.Pubmed_ResultsPanel.Pubmed_DefaultReportPanel.Pubmed_RVDocSum)). Suggested to express GABA-A/glycine receptor-like protein [GGR-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001588;class=Gene) ([Fujiwara et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00015370;class=Paper)).

DVB.Description: An excitatory [GABA](http://www.wormbook.org/db/misc/search.cgi?search_html=on;search_preprints=on;query=GABA)ergic motor neuron/interneuron located in dorso-rectal ganglion. Innervates enteric muscles. Born postembryonically from K rectal epithelial cell; at late L1 stage K rectal epithelial side (on the left side of rectum) divides to generate DVB (K.p) and K.a which acts as the new rectal epithelial cell.
DVB.Function: [Defecation](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_intestine/intestine.html#sec5_3). [AVL](AVLframeset.html) and DVB are excitatory GABAergic motor neurons for the enteric muscles ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.840); [McIntire et al., 1993](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001760;class=Paper)). Together with [AVL](AVLframeset.html), activates expulsion muscle contraction (E.p or EMC).

DVC.Receptor Expression: Expresses [glutamate](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html). receptor subunits, [GLR-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001612;class=Gene) ([Hart et al., 1995](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002309;class=Paper)). Variably expresses the serotonin receptor [SER-4](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00004779;class=Gene) (can be instead DVA) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WDG-49JPMWH-6&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=62cdf52096d8c8487508967cd90e2472)).

FLPL.Description: Have ciliated endings in head, not part of a sensillum. The endings are not open to outside. Wrap around a branch of the lateral ILso cell just below the region where the socket cell surrounds the [IL neurons](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Innerlabialsensilla33).
FLPL.Function: [Nose touch](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_behavior/behavior.html#sec2_7) avoidance. Nose-on collision with an object such as an eyelash initiates backward movement of _C. elegans_. Three classes of mechanosensory neurons ([ASH,](ASHframeset.html) FLP, and [OLQ](OLQframeset.html)) act in parallel to mediate this response. Each sensory neuron class accounts for a fraction of the normal response, as follows: [ASH](ASHframeset.html), 45%; FLP, 29%; and [OLQ](OLQframeset.html), 5%. The remaining responses (~10%) are mediated by the [ALM](ALMframeset.html) and [AVM](AVMframeset.html) neurons, which sense anterior body touch ([Kaplan and Driscoll, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.785); [Goodman, 2006](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_mechanosensation/mechanosensation.html)).
FLPL.Receptor Expression: Express mammalian capsaicin receptor-like channel protein [OSM-9](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003889;class=Gene) ([Colbert et al., 1997](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/17/21/8259)). Express alpha subunits of a nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, [DEG-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000951;class=Gene) and [DES-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000955;class=Gene) ([Treinin and Chalfie, 1995](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WSS-4CWYS0K-R&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=6d77922c0d406fdedd8bb40382906482), [Treinin. et al., 1998](http://www.pnas.org/content/95/26/15492.long)). Express glutamate receptor subunit, [GLR-4](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001615;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express [MEC-10](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003174;class=Gene) (degenerin) which comprise part of a mechanosensory transduction channel ([Huang and Chalfie, 1994](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=%5Bcgc1871%5D;class=Paper)). Express [DEL-1](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000952;class=Gene), a DEG/ENaC family member which may be a subunit of a mechanically gated ion channel that contributes to nematode proprioception ([Tavernarakis et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002646;class=Paper)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc2646%5D/?%5Cb%5Bt%FE%5D%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dv%5Be%E9%E8%EA%EB%5Dr%5Bn%F1%5D%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dr%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dk%5Bi%ED%EC%EE%EF%5D%5Bs%DF%5D%5Cb)). Express [UNC-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006748;class=Gene), a DEG/ENaC family member homologous to subunits of a candidate mechanically gated ion channel ([Tavernarakis et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002646;class=Paper)).

FLPR.Description: Have ciliated endings in head, not part of a sensillum. The endings are not open to outside. Wrap around a branch of the lateral ILso cell just below the region where the socket cell surrounds the [IL neurons](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Innerlabialsensilla33).

Nose-on collision with an object such as an eyelash initiates backward movement of _C. elegans_. Each sensory neuron class accounts for a fraction of the normal response, as follows: [ASH](ASHframeset.html), 45%; FLP, 29%; and [OLQ](OLQframeset.html), 5%. The remaining responses (~10%) are mediated by the [ALM](ALMframeset.html) and [AVM](AVMframeset.html) neurons, which sense anterior body touch ([Kaplan and Driscoll, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.785); [Goodman, 2006](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_mechanosensation/mechanosensation.html)).

Express alpha subunits of a nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, [DEG-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000951;class=Gene) and [DES-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000955;class=Gene) ([Treinin and Chalfie, 1995](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B6WSS-4CWYS0K-R&_user=10&_rdoc=1&_fmt=&_orig=search&_sort=d&_docanchor=&view=c&_acct=C000050221&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=10&md5=6d77922c0d406fdedd8bb40382906482), [Treinin. et al., 1998](http://www.pnas.org/content/95/26/15492.long)). Express glutamate receptor subunit, [GLR-4](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001615;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express [MEC-10](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003174;class=Gene) (degenerin) which comprise part of a mechanosensory transduction channel ([Huang and Chalfie, 1994](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=%5Bcgc1871%5D;class=Paper)). Express [DEL-1](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000952;class=Gene), a DEG/ENaC family member which may be a subunit of a mechanically gated ion channel that contributes to nematode proprioception ([Tavernarakis et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002646;class=Paper)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc2646%5D/?%5Cb%5Bt%FE%5D%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dv%5Be%E9%E8%EA%EB%5Dr%5Bn%F1%5D%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dr%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dk%5Bi%ED%EC%EE%EF%5D%5Bs%DF%5D%5Cb)). Express [UNC-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00006748;class=Gene), a DEG/ENaC family member homologous to subunits of a candidate mechanically gated ion channel ([Tavernarakis et al., 1997](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00002646;class=Paper)).

HSNL.Description: Hermaphrodite specific motor neurons. These cells die in male embryo. The HSNs are generated in the tail of the embryo and then migrate anteriorly to positions near the middle of the animal in both sexes. Therefore, it appears that the decision for cell death in male is not made at the time that the cells are born ([Sulston et al., 1983](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/Sulstonemblin_1983/toc.html)). HSNR axon travels in the right fascicle of VNC, whereas HSNL axon travels in the left side. Axon outgrowth begins during L2 and L3 and is guided by the epithelial cells of the developing vulva and processes of the ventral nerve cord ([PVP](PVPframeset.html) and [PVQ](PVQframeset.html) processes). Vulval precursor cells guide the emerging HSN processes ventrally. They also organize the two HSN processes to join the ventral nerve cord in two separate fascicles and induce them to defasciculate from the ventral nerve cord and branch at the vulva ([Garriga et al.,1993](http://dev.biologists.org/cgi/reprint/117/3/1071)). Synapse formation takes place in the L3 and L4 stages. For a more detailed anatomical description of HSN neurons also refer to [Reproductive System-Egg-laying apparatus](../../hermaphrodite/egglaying apparatus/Eggframeset.html).
HSNL.Function: Innervate the vulval muscles and stimulate egg laying by hermaphrodites. Laser ablation of both HSN neurons results in animals that fail to lay eggs normally and become severely bloated with eggs retained in the uterus ([egl phenotype](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/phenotype?name=egl)). HSN neurons are the only neurons of the egg-laying circuitry, as defined by the synaptic connectivity, that have been shown to be required for normal egg-laying ([Chalfie and White, 1988](http://cshmonographs.org/index.php/monographs/article/view/5026)). Hermaphrodites that lack the HSN motor neurons do lay eggs in response to exogenous serotonin ([Trent et al, 1983](http://www.genetics.org/cgi/reprint/104/4/619)).
HSNL.Neurotransmitter: [Serotonin](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_monoamines/monoamines.html#sec5) ([Desai et al., 1988](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00001105;class=Paper)). Express VMaT,[ CAT-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000295;class=Gene) ([Duerr et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/72)). Express tryptophan hydroxylase, [ TPH-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=tph-1;class=Locus)([Sze et al., 2000](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003903;class=Paper)). [Acetylcholine ](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html)([weak and variable staining](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?rid=ce2.table.5914)). [Rand and Nonet, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?rid=ce2.table.5914). Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=nlp-3;class=Locus) and [NLP-15](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003753;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)) and [NLP-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003746;class=Gene) (M. Barr, pers. comm.; [Nathoo et al., 2001](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc4975%5D/?%5Cb%5Bn%F1%5D%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5D%5Bt%FE%5Dh%5Bo%BA%F3%F2%F4%F6%F5%F8%5D%5Bo%BA%F3%F2%F4%F6%F5%F8%5D%5Cb)). Express FMRFamide-like neuropeptide [F](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=flp-5)[LP-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001448;class=Gene) (M. Barr; K. Kim and C. Li, pers. comm.).
HSNL.Receptor Expression: Express [MEC-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003170;class=Gene) which is part of the degenerin/epithelial Na+ channel complex ([Chelur et al., 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005591;class=Paper)). Express G protein-linked [acetylcholine receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html#sec6) [GAR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001518;class=Gene) ([Lee et al., 2000](http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/cgi-bin/fulltext/119005436/HTMLSTART)). Possibly express [glutamate receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html) subunit [GLR-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001616;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc4567%5D/?%5Cbm%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dr%5Bi%ED%EC%EE%EF%5D%5Bc%E7%5Dq%5Cb)). Suggested to express GABA-A/glycine receptor-like protein [GGR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001587;class=Gene) ([Fujiwara et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00015370;class=Paper)).

Express tryptophan hydroxylase, [ TPH-1 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=tph-1;class=Locus)([Sze et al., 2000](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00003903;class=Paper)). [Acetylcholine ](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html)([weak and variable staining](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?rid=ce2.table.5914)). [Rand and Nonet, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?rid=ce2.table.5914). Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene)[](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=nlp-3;class=Locus) and [NLP-15](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003753;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)) and [NLP-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003746;class=Gene) (M. Barr, pers. comm.; [Nathoo et al., 2001](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc4975%5D/?%5Cb%5Bn%F1%5D%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5D%5Bt%FE%5Dh%5Bo%BA%F3%F2%F4%F6%F5%F8%5D%5Bo%BA%F3%F2%F4%F6%F5%F8%5D%5Cb)). Express FMRFamide-like neuropeptide [F](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=flp-5)[LP-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001448;class=Gene) (M. Barr; K. Kim and C. Li, pers. comm.).
HSNR.Receptor Expression: Express [MEC-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003170;class=Gene) which is part of the degenerin/epithelial Na+ channel complex ([Chelur et al., 2002](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005591;class=Paper)). Express G protein-linked [acetylcholine receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html#sec6) [GAR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001518;class=Gene) ([Lee et al., 2000](http://www3.interscience.wiley.com/cgi-bin/fulltext/119005436/HTMLSTART)). Possibly express [glutamate receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html) subunit [GLR-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001616;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bcgc4567%5D/?%5Cbm%5Ba%AA%E1%E0%E2%E5%E4%E3%E6%5Dr%5Bi%ED%EC%EE%EF%5D%5Bc%E7%5Dq%5Cb)). Suggested to express GABA-A/glycine receptor-like protein [GGR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001587;class=Gene) ([Fujiwara et al., 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00015370;class=Paper)).

I1L.Description: Pharyngeal interneurons. The anterior projections from these cells insert onto muscles pm1 and pm2s, and have a free subcuticular, proprioceptive-like (postulated sensory) ending at the anterior end. They also extend to the basement membrane here to receive input from the somatic [RIP](RIPframeset.html) neurons. The posterior axonal projections of the I1s run within the subventral nerve cords and then run around the pharyngeal nerve ring to the dorsal side where they meet in gap junctions. The termination of the anterior projections in the dorsal pharyngeal nerve cord is variable ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I1L.Function: The pharyngeal and somatic nervous systems are connected to each other via gap junctions between the extrapharyngeal [RIP](RIPframeset.html) neurons and the pharyngeal I1 neurons. When this connection is disrupted by ablation of RIPs, pharyngeal pumping becomes unresponsive to light touch which is sensed by somatic touch neurons ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820)). I1s also synapse on MC neurons and modulate the rate of pharyngeal pumping in the absence of bacteria ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820)).
I1L.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunits, [GLR-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001618;class=Gene) and [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

I1R.Description: Pharyngeal interneurons. The anterior projections from these cells insert onto muscles pm1 and pm2s, and have a free subcuticular, proprioceptive-like (postulated sensory) ending at the anterior end. They also extend to the basement membrane here to receive input from the somatic [RIP](RIPframeset.html) neurons. The posterior axonal projections of the I1s run within the subventral nerve cords and then run around the pharyngeal nerve ring to the dorsal side where they meet in gap junctions. The termination of the anterior projections in the dorsal pharyngeal nerve cord is variable ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I1R.Function: The pharyngeal and somatic nervous systems are connected to each other via gap junctions between the extrapharyngeal [RIP](RIPframeset.html) neurons and the pharyngeal I1 neurons. When this connection is disrupted by ablation of RIPs, pharyngeal pumping becomes unresponsive to light touch which is sensed by somatic touch neurons ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820)). I1s also synapse on MC neurons and modulate the rate of pharyngeal pumping in the absence of bacteria ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820)).
I1R.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunits, [GLR-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001618;class=Gene) and [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

I2L.Description: Pharyngeal interneurons. At the most anterior end of the subventral nerve cords, I2s have proprioceptive-like free subcuticular endings slightly anterior to those of [I1](I1frameset.html)s. They are also coupled by gap junctions to [M1](M1frameset.html) neurons and attach to pm1 muscle at the anterior end. Their posterior processes terminate anterior to the cell bodies of [M3](M3frameset.html) neurons ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I2L.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) and [NLP-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003746;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
I2L.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunits, [GLR-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001618;class=Gene) and [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

I2R.Description: Pharyngeal interneurons. At the most anterior end of the subventral nerve cords, I2s have proprioceptive-like free subcuticular endings slightly anterior to those of [I1](I1frameset.html)s. They are also coupled by gap junctions to [M1](M1frameset.html) neurons and attach to pm1 muscle at the anterior end. Their posterior processes terminate anterior to the cell bodies of [M3](M3frameset.html) neurons ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I2R.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) and [NLP-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003746;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
I2R.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunits, [GLR-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001618;class=Gene) and [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

I3.Description: Pharyngeal interneuron. Anteriorly, I3 is inserted onto muscles pm1 and pm2 and terminates anterior to the dorsal gland cell duct with a proprioceptive-like ending. Posterior process terminates on the dorsal side of the nerve ring ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I3.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunits [GLR-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001618;class=Gene) and [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

I4.Description: Pharyngeal interneuron. The soma of I4 is located on the dorsal side of the terminal bulb commissure. A branch from each side runs within the terminal bulb commissure and continues anteriorly to the nerve ring in the subventral nerve cords. On the ventral side of the nerve ring, these processes cross over to the other side. The right branch travels dorsally around the left half of the nerve ring and ends buried in pm1. The left branch travels dorsally around the right side of the ring and terminates at the level of the right subdorsal apex of the pharyngeal lumen ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I4.Neurotransmitter: Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) and [NLP-13 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003751;class=Gene)([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).

I5.Description: Pharyngeal interneuron. I5 has a very large cell body which is located on the ventral side of the terminal bulb. Two short branches come out of the cell body and split into anterior and posterior projections. At the level of the terminal bulb commissure, the anterior processes end on the cell bodies of [M2](M2frameset.html) motor neurons and are linked to them by desmosomes. Posteriorly, the processes run between pm6 and pm7 and reach a subdorsal position adjacent to the subdorsal marginal cells. Each branch then travels anteriorly to the terminal bulb commissure where they fuse across the dorsal side. Ventrally, these also become attached to the cell bodies of [M2](M2frameset.html) motor neurons by desmosomes. At the level of the subventral nerve cords each branch turns anteriorly and travels to the nerve ring. They make a single closed loop within the nerve ring. A short anterior projection is also seen in the dorsal side of the nerve cord ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I5.Function: [M3](M3frameset.html) and I5 are suggested to facilitate bacterial trapping by regulating the relative duration of muscle relaxation in different regions of the pharynx ([Avery, 1993](http://jeb.biologists.org/cgi/reprint/175/1/283)). Pharyngeal relaxation becomes quicker when I5 is ablated. When both I5 and [M3](M3frameset.html) are ablated there is a delay in relaxation that is indistinguishable from that caused by ablation of [M3](M3frameset.html) alone, suggesting I5 slows down relaxation by inhibiting [M3](M3frameset.html) ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820))
I5.Neurotransmitter: [Serotonin](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_monoamines/monoamines.html#sec5), based on serotonin immunoreactivity ([Sawin et al., 2000](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00004195;class=Paper)). Possibly [glutamate](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html) ([Lee et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/19/1/159#F3)).
I5.Type: Pharyngeal interneuron (can also be a sensory neuron or both)

I6.Description: A bipolar pharyngeal interneuron. Its shorter process travels posteriorly, crosses from left to right subdorsally between pm6 and pm7, and then ends with a free subcuticular ending between pm5 and pm6. The longer process runs anteriorly from the cell body to enter the nerve ring from the dorsal nerve cord, where it terminates on the dorsal side ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
I6.Neurotransmitter: Possibly [acetylcholine](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html) ([Duerr et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/cne.21551)). Express neuropeptide-like protein [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
I6.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunits [GLR-7](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001618;class=Gene) and [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)).

IL1DL.Description: Neurons of [inner labial sensilla](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Innerlabialsensilla33), [ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) with striated rootlets, synapse directly onto muscle cells. [IL1 dendrite ending](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/ward_buildv0.1/art/fig4_large.jpg) does not protrude through the hole in the socket cell to the outside. (See a [3-D reconstruction of IL1 cells](../Images/IL1.mov) by Newbury and Moerman lab. This movie was created from confocal images of a strain expressing the GFP marker linked to the promoter for [Y111B2A.8 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=Y111B2A.8)using Zeiss LSM 5 Pascal software v. 3.2.)
IL1DL.Function: When worms are touched on either the dorsal or ventral sides of their nose with an eyelash, they interrupt the normal pattern of [foraging](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec3_1) and undergo an aversive head-withdrawal reflex. This simple reflex is mediated by two classes of mechanosensory neurons ([OLQ](OLQframeset.html) and IL1) and their synaptic targets, the RMD motor neurons. Killing any of these cells, alone or in combination, diminishes the head withdrawal reflex. IL1, [OLQ](OLQframeset.html), and [RMD](RMDframeset.html) also regulate spontaneous foraging movements. Laser operated animals lacking IL1 and [OLQ](OLQframeset.html) forage abnormally slowly and make exaggerated dorsal and ventral nose turns ([Hart et al., 1995](http://dx.doi.org/doi:10.1038/378082a0); [Kaplan and Driscoll, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK20005/); [Goodman, 2006](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_mechanosensation/mechanosensation.html)). See [head withdrawal and foraging circuit](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.figgrp.787).
IL1DL.Lineage: AB alapappaaa, AB alappppaaa, AB alapaappaa, AB alaappppaa,  AB alppapppaa, AB arapppppaa
IL1DL.Receptor Expression: Express alpha subunit of a nicotinic [acetylcholine receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html#sec6), [DEG-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000951;class=Gene) ([Treinin and Chalfie, 1995](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/0896-6273(95)90231-7)). Express [MEC-6](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003170;class=Gene) which is part of the degenerin/epithelial Na+ channel complex ([Chelur et al., 2002](http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/nature01205)).
IL1DL.Type: All polymodal: [Sensory neuron (Mechanosensory), Motor neuron, Interneuron]

IL2DL.Description: Neurons of [inner labial sensilla](../../hermaphrodite/neuronalsupport/jump.html?newLink=mainframe.htm&newAnchor=Innerlabialsensilla33), [ciliated endings](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html#sec1_1) without rootlets. [IL2 dendrite ending](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/ward_buildv0.1/art/fig4_large.jpg) protrudes through the hole in the socket cell to the outside, hence, it is suggested that IL2 neurons are [chemosensory](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_chemosensation/chemosensation.html). Stains with DiI/Ca Acetate, DiO ([Burket et al., 2006](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.ydbio.2006.07.019)), Di4ANEPPS, and RH421 ([Mille and Shakes, 1995](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8531735?ordinalpos=4&itool=EntrezSystem2.PEntrez.Pubmed.Pubmed_ResultsPanel.Pubmed_DefaultReportPanel.Pubmed_RVDocSum)).
IL2DL.Lineage: AB alapappap, AB alappppap AB alapaappp, AB alaappppp  AB alppapppp, AB arapppppp
IL2DL.Receptor Expression: Express alpha subunit of a nicotinic [acetylcholine receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html#sec6), [ DES-2 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=des-2;class=Locus) ([Treinin. et al., 2001](http://dx.doi.org/10.1006/mcne.2000.0944)). IL2L/R express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene) ([Coates and de Bono, 2002](http://wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)).

LUAL.Function: Suggested to be a "connector cell" between the [PLM](file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Laura/Desktop/WORMATLAS%20Site%20development/Wormatlas072009/neurons/Individual%20Neurons/PLMframeset.html) touch receptors, with which they make gap junctions along the lumbar commissures, and [AVA](AVAframeset.html)/[D](AVDframeset.html) interneurons, with which they make chemical synapses in the ventral cord ([Chalfie et al., 1985](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/reprint/5/4/956)). However, laser ablation does not lead to any abnormalities of movement or touch sensitivity ([Chalfie et al., 1985](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/reprint/5/4/956)) and no role in tap-withdrawal reflex has been found ([Wicks and Rankin, 1995](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/reprint/15/3/2434)).
LUAL.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunit [ GLR-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=glr-5;class=Locus) (Brockie et al., 2001). Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0012-1606(03)00447-0)).

LUAR.Function: Suggested to be a "connector cell" between the [PLM](file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Laura/Desktop/WORMATLAS%20Site%20development/Wormatlas072009/neurons/Individual%20Neurons/PLMframeset.html) touch receptors, with which they make gap junctions along the lumbar commissures, and [AVA](AVAframeset.html)/[D](AVDframeset.html) interneurons, with which they make chemical synapses in the ventral cord ([Chalfie et al., 1985](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/reprint/5/4/956)). LUAR.Receptor Expression: Express glutamate receptor subunit [ GLR-5](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=glr-5;class=Locus) (Brockie et al., 2001). Express a splice variant of the tyramine receptor [SER-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/locus?name=ser-2;class=Locus) ([Tsalik et al., 2003](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S0012-1606(03)00447-0)).

M1.Description: The cell body of M1 is located subdorsally between the muscle and right marginal cell. A single process runs anteriorly in this position to the nerve ring where it then joins the dorsal nerve cord. Upon reaching the level of pm1, the process splits into two to send a vesicle-filled process to each of the subventral nerve cords, synapsing on pm1 and pm2 before reaching the cords. These then run posteriorly for a short length and form synapses on pm2 and pm3 ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
M1.Neurotransmitter: Possibly [acetylcholine](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html) ([Duerr et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/cne.21551)). Express neuropeptide-like protein [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
M1.Receptor Expression: Expresses[ glutamate receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html) subunits, [GLR-2](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001613;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Suggested to express a subunit of the glutamate-gated chloride channel, [AVR-14](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000232;class=Gene) ([Cook et al., 2006](http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.molbiopara.2006.02.003); [Brockie and Maricq, 2006](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html#sec2)).

M2L.Description: M2L/R are a pair of unipolar neurons with processes which run anteriorly in the subventral nerve cords. After making synapses on pm5, these processes travel past the pharyngeal nerve ring without changing course. They then travel dorsally piercing through pm4 while making motor synapses on pm4 along this course. These are one of the two pharyngeal neuron pairs (the other,[ M3](M3frameset.html)) that do not make their dorsal turn within the nerve ring but more anteriorly within the muscle cells. They terminate in gap junctions to each other when they meet on the dorsal side ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
M2L.Function: Unknown or redundant ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820); [Chiang et al., 2002](http://jeb.biologists.org/content/209/10/1859.long)).
M2L.Neurotransmitter: Possibly [acetylcholine](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html) ([Duerr et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/cne.21551)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bmwwm94p39%5D/?%5Cb%5Bi%C3%AD%C3%AC%C3%AE%C3%AF%5D6%5Cb)). Express the FMRFamide-related neuropeptides (FaRP), [ FLP-18](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=flp-18) and [FLP-21](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001464;class=Gene) ([Rogers et al., 2003](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00006174;class=Paper)). Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) and [NLP-13 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003751;class=Gene)([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).

M2R.Description: M2L/R are a pair of unipolar neurons with processes which run anteriorly in the subventral nerve cords. After making synapses on pm5, these processes travel past the pharyngeal nerve ring without changing course. They then travel dorsally piercing through pm4 while making motor synapses on pm4 along this course. These are one of the two pharyngeal neuron pairs (the other,[ M3](M3frameset.html)) that do not make their dorsal turn within the nerve ring but more anteriorly within the muscle cells. They terminate in gap junctions to each other when they meet on the dorsal side ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html)).
M2R.Function: Unknown or redundant ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820); [Chiang et al., 2002](http://jeb.biologists.org/content/209/10/1859.long)).
M2R.Neurotransmitter: Possibly [acetylcholine](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_acetylcholine/acetylcholine.html) ([Duerr et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/cne.21551)[](http://elegans.swmed.edu/wli/%5Bmwwm94p39%5D/?%5Cb%5Bi%C3%AD%C3%AC%C3%AE%C3%AF%5D6%5Cb)). Express the FMRFamide-related neuropeptides (FaRP), [ FLP-18](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=flp-18) and [FLP-21](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001464;class=Gene) ([Rogers et al., 2003](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00006174;class=Paper)). Express neuropeptide-like proteins [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) and [NLP-13 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003751;class=Gene)([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).

M3L.Description: M3s are a bilaterally symmetric pair of inhibitory glutamatergic neurons with output to the metacorpus and possibly the isthmus. They are bipolar neurons with a posterior dendrite and an anterodorsal axon. The posterior process is approximately 5 µm and makes an occasional single synapse to pm5. The anterior projection of these cells grows past the nerve ring, and sends one branch to the dorsal side through pm4 similar to the process of [M2](M2frameset.html) neuron. An additional branch runs posteriorly between pm4 and pm5 at the outside of the pharynx to just behind the nerve ring and terminates with neuromuscular synapses on the posterior edge of pm4. The branches to the dorsal side make no neuromuscular synapses along their dorsal trajectory, but similar to the two subventral branches, they pass posteriorly between pm4 and pm5 at the dorsal edge of the pharynx and form synapses on pm4 behind the nerve ring ([Albertson and Thomson, 1976](http://www.wormatlas.org/ver1/albertson_1975/results.html))..
M3L.Function: M3s modulate the timing of pharyngeal relaxation in corpus and promote rapid relaxation of the pharyngeal muscle following contraction. When M3s are decoupled from the pharyngeal muscle by mutating the postsynaptic receptor (a [glutamate-gated chloride channel](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html#sec2) partly encoded by [_avr-15_](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00000233;class=Gene)) for M3 neurotransmission, the duration of pharyngeal contraction increases ([Dent et al., 1997](http://www.nature.com/emboj/journal/v16/n19/abs/7590561a.html)). Each M3 is suggested to be proprioceptive and fire in response to corpus muscle contraction, which, in turn, induces inhibitory postsynaptic potentials (repolarization) and relaxation of the muscle. This relaxation seems to be important for effective transport of bacteria within the lumen ([Avery and Thomas, 1997](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/bv.fcgi?call=bv.View..ShowSection&rid=ce2.section.820)). Exogenous serotonin mimics the presence of food and induces rapid contraction-relaxation cycles with shortened action potentials in pharynx. This effect is dependent on [MC](MCframeset.html) and M3 neurons (see model below) ([Niacaris and Avery, 2003](http://jeb.biologists.org/cgi/content/full/206/2/223)).
M3L.Neurotransmitter: Possibly glutamate (express the glutamate transporter, [GLT-1](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001620;class=Gene)) ([Radice and Visser, 1996](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00010915;class=Paper), [Lee et al., 1999](http://www.jneurosci.org/content/19/1/159.long)). Express the FMRFamide-related neuropeptide (FaRP), [ FLP-18 ](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=flp-18)([Rogers et al., 2003](http://www.wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00006174;class=Paper)). Express neuropeptide-like protein, [NLP-3](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003741;class=Gene) ([Nathoo et al., 2001](http://www.pnas.org/content/98/24/14000.long)).
M3L.Receptor Expression: Express [ glutamate receptor](http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_ionotropicglutatmaterecep/ionotropicglutatmaterecep.html) subunit [GLR-8](http://www.wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00001619;class=Gene) ([Brockie et al., 2001](http://www.jneurosci.org/cgi/content/full/21/5/1510)). Express neuropeptide Y receptor like protein, [NPR-1](http://wormbase.org/db/gene/gene?name=WBGene00003807;class=Gene) ([Coates and de Bono, 2002](http://wormbase.org/db/misc/paper?name=WBPaper00005512;class=Paper)).

The anterior projection of these cells grows past the nerve ring, and sends one branch to the dorsal side through pm4 similar to the process of [M2](M2frameset.html) neuron.
